abstract: Prospects of Alabama's men's basketball program, long overshadowed by football team's success, have brightened since hiring of coach Avery Johnson; new coach's mandate is to identify NBA-ready recruits while instilling in less-heralded players work ethic and competitive edge as intense as his own.
lead_paragraph: The Crimson Tide are 16-11 thanks to a multimillion-dollar investment and the hiring of Avery Johnson, who is pursuing athletes he might shape into the kind of player he was.

headline.main: Alabama Is Piling Up Victories, and No, It’s Not the Football Team
headline.print_headline: Alabama Is Piling Up Victories, and No, It’s Not the Football Team

snippet: The Crimson Tide are 16-11 thanks to a multimillion-dollar investment and the hiring of Avery Johnson, who is pursuing athletes he might shape into the kind of player he was.
